required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: NAC Supplementation and Skeletal Muscle Performance
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of NAC Supplementation on Skeletal Muscle Performance Following Aseptic Injury Induced by Exercise

brief_summary.textblock: In this investigation the investigators utilized NAC administration to foster GSH availability during an 8-day period following eccentric exercise-induced muscle damage in order to test our hypotheses: i) antioxidant supplementation does not disturb performance and adaptations induced by exercise-induced muscle injury and ii) redox status perturbations in skeletal muscle are pivotal for the regulation of muscle' inflammatory response and repair.

detailed_description.textblock:
The major thiol-disulfide couple of reduced (GSH) and oxidized glutathione (GSSG) is a key-regulator of major transcriptional pathways regulating aseptic inflammation and recovery of skeletal muscle following aseptic injury. Antioxidant supplementation may hamper exercise-induced cellular adaptations.
Our objective was to examine how thiol-based antioxidant supplementation affects skeletal muscle's performance and redox-sensitive signalling during the inflammatory and repair phases associated with exercise-induced micro-trauma.In a double-blind, counterbalanced design, 12 men received placebo (PLA) or N-acetylcysteine (NAC, 20 mg/kg/day) following muscle-damaging exercise (300 eccentric contractions). In each trial, muscle performance was measured at baseline, post-exercise, 2h post-exercise and daily for 8 consecutive days. Muscle biopsies from vastus lateralis and blood samples were collected pre-exercise and 2h, 2d, and 8d post-exercise.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in reduced glutathione in blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 5 minutes post-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: Concentration of reduced glutathione in red blood cells

primary_outcome.measure: Change in reduced glutathione in muscle
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, 2 days post-exercise, 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: concentration of reduced glutathione in quadriceps skeletal muscle group

primary_outcome.measure: Change in protein carbonyls in red blood cells and serum
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 5 minutes post-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in protein carbonyls in muscle
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, 2 days post-exercise, 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: protein carbonyl concentration in vastus lateralis skeletal muscle

primary_outcome.measure: Change in thiobarbituric acid reactive substances in red blood cells and serum
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 5 minutes post-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: thiobarbituric acid reactive substances concentration in serum and red blood cells

primary_outcome.measure: Change in thiobarbituric acid reactive substances in muscle
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, 2 days post-exercise, 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: thiobarbituric acid reactive substances concentration in vastus lateralis skeletal muscle

primary_outcome.measure: Change in oxidized glutathione in red blood cells and blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 5 minutes post-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: Concentration of oxidized glutathione in red blood cells and whole blood

primary_outcome.measure: Change in total antioxidant capacity in serum
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 5 minutes post-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in oxidized glutathione in muscle
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, 2 days post-exercise, 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: concentration of oxidized glutathione in vastus lateralis skeletal muscle

primary_outcome.measure: Change in catalase activity in red blood cells and serum
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 5 minutes post-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in glutathione peroxidase activity in red blood cells
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 5 minutes post-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in creatine kinase activity in plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 5 minutes post-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in C-reactive protein in plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 5 minutes post-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in macrophage infiltration in muscle
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, 2 days post-exercise, 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in white blood cell count in blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 5 minutes post-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in neutrophil count in blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 5 minutes post-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in fatty acid binding protein in plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 5 minutes post-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in cortisol concentration in blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 5 minutes post-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in testosterone concentration in plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 5 minutes post-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change in cytokine concentration in plasma
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 5 minutes post-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of IL-1β, IL-4, IL-6, TNF-α, IL-8, IL-10, IL-12p70 concentrations in plasma

primary_outcome.measure: Change in adhesion molecule concentration in blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 5 minutes post-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of ICAM-1, VCAM-1, sP-selectin, sE-selectin concentrations in plasma

primary_outcome.measure: Change in intracellular signalling proteins in muscle
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, 2 days post-exercise, 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of phosphorylation levels of protein kinase B (Akt), mammalian target of rapamycin (mTOR), serine/threonine kinase (p70S6K), ribosomal protein S6 (rpS6), nuclear factor κB (NFκB), serine⁄threonine mitogen activated protein kinase (p38-MAPK) in vastus lateralis muscle.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in myogenic determination factor (MyoD) protein levels in muscle
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, 2 days post-exercise, 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: MyoD expression in vastus lateralis muscle

primary_outcome.measure: Change in tumor necrosis factor α in muscle
primary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, 2 days post-exercise, 8 days post-exercise
primary_outcome.description: Protein levels of TNF-α in vastus lateralis muscle

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in muscle function of knee extensor and flexor muscle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, 5 minutes post-exercise, 2 hours post-exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise
secondary_outcome.description: assessment of muscle peak and mean torque of knee extensors and flexors on an isokinetic dynamometer at 0, 90 and 180 degrees/sec
Assessment of percent (%) lean body mass.
Assessment of maximal oxygen consumption, an indice of cardiovascular conditioning

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in profile of dietary intake
secondary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of dietary intake with emphasis on antioxidant element intake

secondary_outcome.time_frame: one hour before exercise, daily for 8 days post-exercise
secondary_outcome.description: The prevalence of potential side-effects (such as headaches or abdominal pain or any other discomfort) was monitored using a subjective 0-10 side-effects scale on a daily bases by an unblinded investigator (for ethical reasons).

arm_group.description: n-acetylcysteine supplementation, orally in three daily dosages, at 20 mg/kg/day, daily for eight days after exercise placebo, orally in three daily dosages, content: 500 mL drink that contained water (375 mL), sugar-free cordial (125 ml), and 2 g of low-calorie glucose/dextrose powder.

intervention.description: n-acetylcysteine administration: 20 mg//kg/day, orally, daily for eight days following exercise placebo administration: 500 mL orally, daily for eight days following exercise

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
a) recreationally trained as evidenced by their maximal oxygen consumption levels (VO2max >45 ml/kg/min), b) were engaged in systematic exercise at least three times/week for ≥12 months), c) non-smokers, d) abstained from any vigorous physical activity during the study, e)abstained from consumption of caffeine, alcohol, performance-enhancing or antioxidant supplements, and medications during the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
a) a known NAC intolerance or allergy, b) a recent febrile illness, c) history of muscle lesion, d) lower limb trauma

facility.name: Laboratory of Physical Education & Sport Performance
